title: albon
author: albon
created_time: October 28, 2022, 06:34:20 PMLast edit: October 29, 2022, 01:42:06 PM by albon
content: What happened:  This is a new exchange platform that someone sent to me to trade on, and after I tried to withdraw the money I got from his promo code for a value of $6000, it turned out that this platform is a scam exchange asking for a deposit of at least 0.01 BTC so that I can withdraw.Reference Link:  https://foxcoinby.com/Amount Scammed:  0.296000 BTCPayment Method: BitcoinProof of Payment: Information about a scam domain :Quote from: SOURCE: https://www.domainiq.com/domain?foxcoinby.comDomain Name: FOXCOINBY.COMRegistrar:   Publicdomainregistry IANA ID 303Status: clientTransferProhibitedRegistrant Name: VerderanRegistrant Email: toknuyistu@vusra.comRegistrant Address: 1364 Gladwell Street, Longview, Tx, 75601, USCreation Date: October 17, 2022 (1 week ago)Update Date: October 17, 2022 (1 week ago)Expiration Date: October 17, 2023Age:12 daysAdditional Notes: Do not be deceived by the temptations of new exchange platforms, there are a lot of scam platforms these days so we all have to expose them everywhere so that they don't scam the beginners investorsSo*Do not trust strangers*There is no free money*Do not deposit your money in any new exchange that you do not know

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: albon on October 28, 2022, 06:34:20 PMAmount Scammed:  0.296000 BTCIf I understood everything correctly, technically, they didn't scam you [they wanted to scam you for 0.01BTC (roughly $200), but had no luck]... Am I correct?Regardless of that, this is a popular theme/template among scammers [unfortunately]:e.g. I just got the following results when I looked for similar websites!Fexbit.ltd [archived]Binexam.com [archived]Allexbit.com [archived]Bitaxen.com [archived]Clowbitc.com [archived]Bitcexmo.com [archived]Exbitcbulls.com [archived]Revox-coin.com [archived]Astralcoinex.com [archived]Fexdaotrade.com [archived]Goldencoinex.com [archived]Bull24coin.com [archived]Hotcoinstrade.com [archived]Exdaotrade.com [archived]Cryptoscoin24.com [archived]Ultragoldcoin.com [archived]Fextradecoin.com [archived]

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: SFR10 on October 29, 2022, 05:38:28 PMIf I understood everything correctly, technically, they didn't scam you [they wanted to scam you for 0.01BTC (roughly $200), but had no luck]... Am I correct?Yes that's rightQuote from: SFR10 on October 29, 2022, 05:38:28 PMRegardless of that, this is a popular theme/template among scammers [unfortunately]:e.g. I just got the following results when I looked for similar websites!Fexbit.ltd [archived]Binexam.com [archived]Allexbit.com [archived]Bitaxen.com [archived]Clowbitc.com [archived]Bitcexmo.com [archived]Exbitcbulls.com [archived]Revox-coin.com [archived]Astralcoinex.com [archived]Fexdaotrade.com [archived]Goldencoinex.com [archived]Bull24coin.com [archived]Hotcoinstrade.com [archived]Exdaotrade.com [archived]Cryptoscoin24.com [archived]Ultragoldcoin.com [archived]Fextradecoin.com [archived]Oh my god, all of these sites use the same template I have no doubts that they are all scam sites.Good catch dude

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: Good catch SFR! Quote from: SFR10 on October 29, 2022, 05:38:28 PMe.g. I just got the following results when I looked for similar websites!I noticed that whenever someone report a scam website you quickly find all the websites which use the same template (I also noticed this on the gambling section when a new casino with some other members). Sorry for asking but am curious to know how do you do that? Do you search for some specific keywords you take from the website or is there a search engine that searches for websites which are using the same template? (sorry if this sounds stupid.)

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: This isn't the first time I've often received messages from strangers offering new trading platforms or strangers asking for help for any reason and giving codes giving lots of Bitcoins, so I think this is an old scam trick that still exists today they send random DMs to some people so they can be fooled, but I think they are aware that there is no easy free money so don't ever do anything if you are tempted by BTC there are many new trading platforms so just be careful.I've often before in this thread found finds like this almost exactly the same and slightly different from the template alone.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: albon on October 28, 2022, 06:34:20 PMAdditional Notes: Do not be deceived by the temptations of new exchange platforms, there are a lot of scam platforms these days so we all have to expose them everywhere so that they don't scam the beginners investorsIndeed in 2022, very many types of crypto exchange sites have sprung up on the internet, no half-hearted there are hundreds of victims screaming for loss.For this reason, the increasing number of frauds on the internet with various modes, of course we all here need to remind each other.Like this guy.Quotehttps://trustedrevie.ws/reviews/foxcoinby.comWhen we examine the site in general, I get an unsatisfactory result. For more details about this site, please provide information to users. When I try to reach the foxcoinby.com domain, I can see that it has just been opened.I'm sure you're not the first victim they're after, maybe there were some others who were disappointed using the Foxcoinby.com exchange site, like the quote above....I'm sure if crypto users are a little careful and want to try checking reviews on the exchange site they want, of course there's a high chance that they will avoid cases of fraud and so on.

comments.author: arabspaceship123
comments.body: It's a large scam operation if the same scammer's using the sites you've caught. If they're using the same code they're connected. How long have they been stealing crypto?Quote from: SFR10 on October 29, 2022, 05:38:28 PMe.g. I just got the following results when I looked for similar websites!Fexbit.ltd [archived]Binexam.com [archived]Allexbit.com [archived]Bitaxen.com [archived]Clowbitc.com [archived]Bitcexmo.com [archived]Exbitcbulls.com [archived]Revox-coin.com [archived]Astralcoinex.com [archived]Fexdaotrade.com [archived]Goldencoinex.com [archived]Bull24coin.com [archived]Hotcoinstrade.com [archived]Exdaotrade.com [archived]Cryptoscoin24.com [archived]Ultragoldcoin.com [archived]Fextradecoin.com [archived]

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: albon on October 29, 2022, 05:58:36 PMOh my god, all of these sites use the same template I have no doubts that they are all scam sites.It's worth noting that "most" of them are using the same registrar as well, so you can refer to my post when you report them [more reports = better results]:REPORT ABUSE > Click "Process For Handling Abuse" > Other > Scam website.Quote from: khaled0111 on October 29, 2022, 07:50:18 PMSorry for asking but am curious to know how do you do that? Do you search for some specific keywords you take from the website or is there a search engine that searches for websites which are using the same template? (sorry if this sounds stupid.)It's a combination of a few things... Sometimes you get lucky with just a few keywords but for the most part, I look for similar images + plagiarized content.Quote from: arabspaceship123 on October 30, 2022, 07:32:07 PMIt's a large scam operation if the same scammer's using the sites you've caught. If they're using the same code they're connected.Some of them probably belong to a single scammer [e.g. both "clowbitc" and "bitcexmo" were registered on the same date while using the same registrar], but there are also some marketplaces that sell such themes/templates and that leads to multiple scammers using the same code [unfortunately].
